title: Docs: security-oidc-code-flow-authentication-tutorial guide
body:
### Describe the bug

I identified several issues in `Protect a web application by using OpenID Connect (OIDC) authorization code flow `   guide[1]:
1. Application creation code[2] for maven fails with error `Could not find artifact io.quarkus.platform:quarkus-maven-plugin:jar:999-SNAPSHOT `. This can be fixed by changing `mvn io.quarkus.platform:quarkus-maven-plugin:999-SNAPSHOT:create` to `mvn io.quarkus:quarkus-maven-plugin:999-SNAPSHOT:create` .
2.  [Improvement]: code example[3] get claims by name, while it can be done by `Claims` enum without a risk of typos (eg `this.idToken.getClaim(Claims.preferred_username);` instead of `this.idToken.getClaim("preferred_username");`)
3. Link to "Create keycloak realm"[4]  leads to the header of the page (probably should be https://www.keycloak.org/docs/latest/server_admin/index.html#configuring-realms instead)
4. Current example requires log-in on every page refresh. It would be nice to have a description on how to make this more permanent.

[1] https://quarkus.io/version/main/guides/security-oidc-code-flow-authentication-tutorial
[2] https://quarkus.io/version/main/guides/security-oidc-code-flow-authentication-tutorial#create-the-maven-project
[3] https://quarkus.io/version/main/guides/security-oidc-code-flow-authentication-tutorial#write-the-application
[4] end of https://quarkus.io/version/main/guides/security-oidc-code-flow-authentication-tutorial#start-and-configure-the-keycloak-server
